alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 12 at 4:22AM MDT until June 12 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL EARLY EVENING FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND THE SANDIA/MANZANO MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .An upper level low pressure system passing to the north of New Mexico will produce strong southwest winds this afternoon and early evening. The combination of strong winds with very low humidity, warm temperatures, and unstable conditions will create critical fire weather. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 8 PM MDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106) this afternoon and early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 15 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph on Monday. The strongest winds will occur south of I-40. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 11 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
